item.title: Offically Stop syipker The Real way!
item.dc:creator: @frugoo_scape frugoo scape
item.description:
@frugoo_scape wrote:

Here you go, just copy and paste this. I am 100% sure this will help you.
I took the time to convert Unicode to Java string literal. Your welcome.
playerName.replaceAll("\u2666", " “);
playerName.replaceAll(”\u2665", " “);
playerName.replaceAll(”\u2663", " “);
playerName.replaceAll(”\u2660", " ");
playerName.trim();

Read full topic

item.title: Offically Stop syipker The Real way!
item.dc:creator: @frugoo_scape frugoo scape
item.description:
@frugoo_scape wrote:

[quote=“lawl, post:3, topic:124448”][quote author=frugoo scape link=topic=174281.msg1607088#msg1607088 date=1184745014]
Add this in your client.java .

playerName.replaceAll(“”, " ");
playerName.replaceAll(“”, " ");
playerName.replaceAll(“”, " ");
playerName.replaceAll(“”, " ");

All Character you have to block: http://htmlhelp.com/reference/html40/entities/symbols.html

There you go noobs, all done. Copy and paste.

You have to change the encoding of the file though -.-.
[/quote]
by the way if we’re assuming that what you are trying to do is correct, the optimal approach would be
playerName.replaceAll("[]", " ");
because afterall, replaceAll uses regex[/quote]
Yeah compile that. Your funny…
Unicode encoding in an ANSI encoded file.
Slap your self.

Read full topic

item.title: Offically Stop syipker The Real way!
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

Unfortunately you are retarded.

wL based servers absolutely suck dick at managing clients. Bringing on enough of them will cause the JVM to use far too much memory, (400-800MB) and it will eventually crash.

You can’t stop this by blocking characters, you might have to use a shred of your brain to fix this one.

Read full topic
